editing_system.editing module¶

editing_system.editing.edit_videos(num_videos, new_memory, num_blocks, accumulated_memory)¶

Editing videos based upon the Metadata score from the database :param num_videos: Number of videos we want to import to the editor :param new_memory: Totally empty memory, to make sure that the materials are from updated videos :param num_blocks: Number of blocks to be included in the result video :param accumulated_memory: The total memory of the machine, so that we don’t run into repetitive computations :return: updated ff_memory, video_name, first_key, method

editing_system.editing.edit_videos_manual_test()¶
editing_system.editing.editing_import(num_videos)¶

Load generators for the top num_videos metadata scores video clips :param num_videos: number of videos to import to the editing worker :return: the dictionary with format {vid_name: [[editing_pairs], generator]}

editing_system.editing.find_best_editing_pair(ff_memory)¶

Go through three categories of ff_memory data and find the best data by comparing smallest / average score :param ff_memory: the ff_memory generated by epf with generators :return: the key and the category of the methods

editing_system.editing.no_none_in_editing_range(imported_videos_sources)¶

This method checks whether there is none values in the editing range from the data base :param imported_videos_sources: Newly imported data :return: Boolean values indicating whether there is still none in the editing range

editing_system.editing.update_ff_memory(imported_video_sources, ff_memory_to_update, total_memory)¶

Based on the newly imported video sources, update the frame to frame memory :param imported_video_sources: the dictionary with format {vid_name: [[editing pairs], video generator]]} :param ff_memory_to_update: used to book keeping comparison results :param total_memory: the total machine memory to avoid repetitive computations :return: coordinates for the most compatible keys, ff_memory

editing_system.editing.video_quality_check(imported_videos_sources)¶

Check and make sure the quality of the video is the same through multiple read :param imported_video_sources: the dictionary with format {vid_name: [[editing pairs], video generator]]} :return: whether all videos have good qualities to be read multiple times, if not which one is fucked up

editing_system.editing.video_read_through(video_generator)¶

Read through the video and reset the generator :param video_generator: the generator to read from :return: success read through? and frames length to compare multiple times

editing_system.editing_structures module¶

class editing_system.editing_structures.AssembledBlocks(block_1, block_2, ff_memory, used_keys)¶

Data structure that holds the assembled blocks that are going to generate the final video

assemble_blocks(num_blocks)¶

Assemble blocks based on the initial blocks and ff_memory, the assemble should go behind, different with insertion :param num_blocks: number of blocks needs to be assembled

get_average()¶
class editing_system.editing_structures.EditingBlock(video_name, editing_key, which_method, cluster_index, threshold)¶

A Block that stores all the necessary information for reconstructing video

find_best_compatible_block(ff_memory, used_keys, gradient_avg, ellipse_avg, wave_avg)¶
Parameters:
  • ff_memory – frame(cluster) comparison results from the initialization stage
  • used_keys – representation of the blocks that have already been used in assembled blocks
  • gradient_avg – average value from ff_memory of gradient score
  • ellipse_avg – average value from ff_memory of ellipse score
  • wave_avg – average value from ff_memory of wave score
Returns:

the block info of the key in the ff_memory that has is most compatible with the block, the magnitude should be compared to average, the method that creates this value
get_block_info_from_key(key)¶
Parameters:key – A key from ff_memory that contains self’s info
Returns:a tuple with another block’s info

Bases: sphinx.ext.autodoc.importer._MockObject

database_check()¶

Check whether there are none values in the top meta scores in the database :return: True indicating editing can go on False other wise

edit_videos()¶

Edit videos when there is metascore and there is no none in the editing range update in the database

Combine the self.ff_memory with the new_memory :param new_memory: The new memory generated from edit videos

static top_non_zero(top_num)¶

Check and make sure that all the top ten scores are non-zero :param top_num: how many numbers of video metadata to check :return: whether there is zero in top ten Metascore

top_updated(top_num)¶

This function will check whether the top Metascore has changed or not :param top_num: how many numbers of video metadata to check :return: whether metadata is updated

static upload_memory(new_memory, vid_name)¶

Upload the memory to database :param new_memory: Newly generated memory :param vid_name: unique vid_name of time stamp plus longitude and latitude

This function is just for editor point finder :param harris_result: harris_value result :param Sx2: Sobel X square :param Sy2: Sobel Y square :param Sxy: Sobel X*Y :return: Eigen value matrix for area calculation

editing_system.epf module¶

editing_system.epf.build_edit_frame_dict(vid_path, to_edit)¶
Parameters:
  • vid_path – The full path to the video
  • to_edit – the editing pair stored in the database of that video
Returns:

dictionary with editing pair as key and its corresponding frames in the video as value
editing_system.epf.compare_ellipse(imgs)¶

Calculate the image ellipse compatibility by comparing generated ellipse area :param img1: The frame read from first video :param img2: The frame read from second video :return: a float suggesting the compatibility, smaller the better

editing_system.epf.compare_frame_cluster(vid1_name, vid1_generator, key_1, vid2_name, vid2_generator, key_2, ff_memory)¶
editing_system.epf.compare_frame_generator_gradient(vid1_name, vid1_generator, key_1, vid2_name, vid2_generator, key_2, ff_memory)¶
editing_system.epf.compare_frame_list_gradient(vid1_name, frame_list1, key_1, vid2_name, frame_list2, key_2, ff_memory)¶
editing_system.epf.compare_gradient(imgs)¶

Calculate the image gradient compatibility with jit enabled methods :param img1: The frame read from first video :param img2: The frame read from second video :return: a vector with both magnitude and direction, smaller the better

editing_system.epf.compare_wave(imgs)¶

Generate fourier transformation compatibility score by comparing result generated by synthesis on both images :param img1: The frame read from first video :param img2: The frame read from second video :return: the compatibility score

editing_system.epf.editing_compare_frame_cluster(vid1_name, vid1_generator, key_1, vid2_name, vid2_generator, key_2, ff_memory, total_memory)¶

The actual editing method comparing two videos by clustering contents and run three DA methods :param vid1_name: Name of the video :param vid1_generator: Video’s frame generator :param key_1: from which editing point :param vid2_name: same above :param vid2_generator: same above :param key_2: same above :param ff_memory: editing book keeper, keep track of all the results :param total_memory: the total machine memory to avoid repetitive computations :return: updated ff_memory

editing_system.epf.epf_with_generators(vid1_name, vid1_edit_source, vid2_name, vid2_edit_source, ff_memory, total_memory)¶

Treat this function as a dispatcher of the editing compare frame cluster function :param vid1_name: parameter for making ff_memory key :param vid1_edit_source: [[vid1 editing pairs], vid1 generator] :param vid2_name: parameter for making ff_memory key :param vid2_edit_source: [[vid2 editing pairs], vid2_generator] :param ff_memory: ff_memory stands for frames-frames memory, it is used for book keeping/storing comparison results :param total_memory: the total machine memory to avoid repetitive computations :return: updated ff_memory

editing_system.epf.generate_ellipse_compatibility_score(eigen_value_matrix_1, eigen_value_matrix_2)¶

Generate corner detection compatibility score by calculating and compare ellipse areas for each pixel on both images :param eigen_value_matrix_1: image shape with depth 2 for image 1 :param eigen_value_matrix_2: image shape with depth 2 for image 2 :return: a float number suggesting ellipse compatibility

editing_system.epf.generate_gradient_similarity_vector(intensity_1, intensity_2, direction_1, direction_2)¶

This function is for Gradient. Based on both images’ edge vectors’ directions and intensity we can have a compatibility vector :param intensity_1: Gradient Intensity for pic 1 :param intensity_2: Gradient Intensity for pic 2 :param direction_1: Gradient Direction for pic 1 :param direction_2: Gradient Direction for pic 2 :return: a similarity vector suggesting compatibility

editing_system.epf.gradient_epf(vid1_name, vid1_edit_frame_dict, vid2_name, vid2_edit_frame_dict, ff_memory)¶
Parameters:
  • vid1_name – parameter for making ff_memory key
  • vid1_edit_frame_dict – will be used for calculations
  • vid2_name – parameter for making ff_memory key
  • vid2_edit_frame_dict – will be used for calculations
  • ff_memory – ff_memory stands for frames-frames memory, it is used for book keeping/storing comparison results
Returns:

the lowest vector and its coordinate along with updated ff_memory for gradient
editing_system.epf.gradient_epf_with_generators(vid1_name, vid1_edit_source, vid2_name, vid2_edit_source, ff_memory)¶
Parameters:
  • vid1_name – parameter for making ff_memory key
  • vid1_edit_source – [[vid1 editing pairs], vid1 generator]
  • vid2_name – parameter for making ff_memory key
  • vid2_edit_source – [[vid2 editing pairs], vid2_generator]
  • ff_memory – ff_memory stands for frames-frames memory, it is used for book keeping/storing comparison results
Returns:

the lowest vector and its coordinate along with updated ff_memory for gradient

editing_system.range_finder module¶

editing_system.range_finder.calcEntropy(img)¶
editing_system.range_finder.get_entropy_list(video_name)¶

editing_system.range_finder.range_filter(range_result)¶

Make sure that there is no too short editing range :param range_result: Result generated by the range_finder :return: filtered range result

editing_system.range_finder.range_finder(video_name, battery_level, percent_to_use)¶

Generate editing points determined by the frame’s entropy value :param video_name: the metadata worker will find range and editing point for this video :param battery_level: the battery level metadata associated with the video :param percent_to_use: the total percent of frames we are gonna grab from this clip, should be less than one :return: A bunch of ranges that will be used for video editor

editing_system.range_finder.sort_dictionary(dictionary_to_sort)¶
